Application

Class GameDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application.GameDefinition

  • public class GameDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
    This class runs an instance of the game. Methods of this class enable the condition of piece and board to continue. Also has methods for moves.
    Author:
    Omar Atieh (oa183), Hamid Abbasi (ha354)

      No-arg constructor that initializes the board and add pieces onto the board

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameDefinition

        public GameDefinition()
        No-arg constructor that initializes the board and add pieces onto the board

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public static int[] getIndex(java.lang.String str)
        This method gets a set of coordinates from the input string.
        Parameters:
        str - The input string with the coordinates
        Returns:
        Array of cooridnates [y][x] which represent file, and rank respectively. Coordinates range from 0-8 inclusively.

      • printChessBoard

        public void printChessBoard()
        This No-arg method prints the chess board. Call either before or after a move to let the players know the current board condition. This method returns nothing.

      • move

        public boolean move(int[] starting,
                    int[] ending,
                    boolean player1Move)
        This method verifies a move. Checks if the move puts the player's king in check, if so move is considered invalid. As a result, move is not made and the method returns false. However, in case of a valid move, board is updated.
        Parameters:
        starting - Coordinates of piece to be moved
        ending - Final coordinates of where to move the piece
        player1Move - tells whose play it is.
        Returns:
        false if invalid. True if move is verified and the board is updated.

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck(int[] starting,
                       boolean player1)
        This method concludes whether the piece moved checks a king.
        Parameters:
        starting - Coordinates of the piece potentially putting a king in check
        player1 - True if king of player1 i.e. white is in check, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the mentioned piece puts the particular king into check, false otherwise

      • isCheckMate

        public boolean isCheckMate(boolean player1)
        Concludes if game has ended by investigating if the king specified can legally move to get out of the check returns false if king can move
        Parameters:
        player1 - True if player 1 i.e. white king is in checkmate, false for black king in checkmate.
        Returns:
        true if no more legal moves left and false otherwise

      • isenPassant

        public void isenPassant(boolean player1Turn)
        This method is for a special pawn capture that can only occur immediately after a pawn makes a move of two squares from its starting square, and it could have been captured by an enemy pawn had it advanced only one square. The check is done on all pieces in a row and sets their enPassant values to false, as at that point the possibility to capture that piece via en passante will have passed
        Parameters:
        whiteTurn - checks if player 1's turn; helps in which [y] value to use when checking

      • checkStatus

        public boolean checkStatus()

      • getCoordinatesOfKing

        public int[] getCoordinatesOfKing(boolean player1)
        Finds coordinates of king in question
        Parameters:
        player1 - true if player1 king, false otherwise
        Returns:
        coordinates of king in question

      • kingsMove

        public boolean kingsMove(int[] starting,
                         int[] ending,
                         boolean player1)
        Used together with isCheckMate to conclude whether the king can move legally.
        Parameters:
        starting - starting position of king
        ending - potential destination of king
        player1 - true for king of player 1, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if king can move legally, false otherwise
